body_html:
Eventually we'd like to go that route. For now we're trying to encode this functionality through python callables. Once we have a sufficiently rich collection of reasonable callables (feel free to add yours!) then a more Optimizer like design seems prudent.
…
On Tue, Oct 31, 2017 at 2:33 AM, Alexander G. de G. Matthews < ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks for the info. Amongst the options, are you considering an interface similar to a vanilla TF optimizer? We have cases in GPflow where we would want to swap out a TF optimizer, add a prior to the hyperparameter in question and then swap in a TF sampler, so this has always seemed like a natural option to us. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned.  Thanks for the info. Amongst the options, are you considering an interface
 similar to a vanilla TF optimizer? We have cases in GPflow where we would
 want to swap out a TF optimizer, add a prior to the hyperparameter in
 question and then swap in a TF sampler, so this has always seemed like a
 natural option to us.

body:
Eventually we'd like to go that route. For now we're trying to encode this
functionality through python callables.  Once we have a sufficiently rich
collection of reasonable callables (feel free to add yours!) then a more
Optimizer like design seems prudent.

On Tue, Oct 31, 2017 at 2:33 AM, Alexander G. de G. Matthews <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Thanks for the info. Amongst the options, are you considering an interface
> similar to a vanilla TF optimizer? We have cases in GPflow where we would
> want to swap out a TF optimizer, add a prior to the hyperparameter in
> question and then swap in a TF sampler, so this has always seemed like a
> natural option to us.
>
